Articles.Content: Hi all.  I'm still running KSP v1.5.1 and was wondering what changes were introduced with v1.6.1 and whether it's worth updating.

It's always worth updating. If you're worried about mods or saves breaking, make a backup copy of your 1.5 folder first. Really shouldn't be an issue though, they haven't changed anything major enough to break 95% of mods for a while.
Thanks.  It's usually broken mods that concerns me.

12 minutes ago, Scarecrow said:

Thanks.  It's usually broken mods that concerns me.

Hi.

 

Some mods will work even if not they aren't upgraded.

My potato can't take too much of anything. For me 1.6 runs fine....if I don't look at anything.

The only mod I have is MechJeb. I get a warning but it seems to work perfecly.

 

ME
I don't use Mechjeb, but the mods I do use seem to work OK.  I only have about 5 or 6, but I consider them to be pretty essential.

3 hours ago, Scarecrow said:

It's usually broken mods that concerns me.

1.5 to 1.6 was a very "lightweight" transition-- didn't rework any major features of the game, they just revamped some stock parts and added a new feature or two.  My experience is that virtually no mods got broken in the transition from 1.5 to 1.6, didn't even need a recompile.

In short:  It's a pretty "safe" upgrade.
